main event: Observers at Presque Isle AFB reported a sighting of a circular orange object with four green lights on 10 October 1952.
interesting points: The object was tracked using a theodolite for a duration of 5-8 minutes., The object was observed by ground-radar observers at Frenchville Isle AFS., A possibility was mentioned that the sighting may have been due to upper atmosphere balloons., The object was estimated to be approximately 300 feet in diameter., The investigation referenced the object potentially being related to atmospheric research balloons from Minneapolis.
sighted object: circular orange object with four green lights
witness description: Air Force observers at Presque Isle and Limestone AFB
